revised_title: Anniversary Address: Remembrance of Fellows and Scientific Contributions
tldr: In his annual address, Sir Archibald Geikie remembers the Fellows who passed away and their significant contributions to various scientific fields, including physics, chemistry, geology, biology, and medicine. He also discusses the progress of the Royal Society's work, with a focus on seismology and the Eskdalemuir Observatory.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Obituaries and Biographies
